short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s: For this puzzle, snap the blocks together and click "▶ Run"!
Snap all blocks together to finish your code, then click "Run".
Add a `North` block to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".
Add a `North` block to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "Run".
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Get the bird to the pig!
Get the bird to the bad pig!
Give this one a try.
What can you add to the end of this code to get the bird to the pig?
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!
Challenge: Avoid the TNT to get the bird to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.
Get that pig!
Get the pig any way you can!
Something is wrong here. Help fix the code to get the bird to the pig!
Trace the path to lead the bird to the pig. Avoid TNT or feathers will fly!
Play with these blocks to help the harvester pick the piece of corn.
Use three `move west` blocks and one `pick corn` block to solve this puzzle.
Use three `Move North` blocks and one `Pick Corn` block.
Add one block to help the harvester pick the corn.
Find the bug and fix it!
Try it yourself!
Try it yourself!
Now the harvester needs to pick corn two times!
Add two blocks to finish this puzzle!
Make sure to pick all the corn!
Pick all the corn.
Try it by yourself! Pick all the corn.
Play with these blocks to help the harvester pick corn.
Help the harvester pick all the corn!
Make sure to pick all the corn!
Can you pick all the corn using only **one** move block?
Can you help the harvester find the bug in her code?
Try it yourself! Can you pick the corn at the end too?
Look at all this corn! Can you pick it all by yourself?
Can you change your code to make the harvester pick all the corn?
You will need **one** `Move West` block and **one** `Move North` block.
Try it on your own!
Can you figure out how to pick all the corn?
Help the harvester pick all five ears of corn!
Try one more on your own!
Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can!
Get all three piles to pass this level.
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure.
Use what you learned to get all of the treasure.
Add blocks to this code to get all of the treasure.
What should you add to this code to get all of the treasure?
Write code to get all of this treasure.
**Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way up these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure along this path.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_
Collect at least **3** pieces of treasure to pass this level.
_"Can you help me spot some bugs?"_
This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
Help the artist draw this line two times forward.
Draw a line forward five times.
Now, use a `repeat` loop to draw this line five times!
Draw a line seven steps long. This will become our horizon.
Let's put a nice hill in the back.
Use the `repeat` loop to add waves to the water.
We need a ladder up to the boat.
Challenge: Fix the stairs.
Help me put down stones so I don't fall in!
Help me build steps to watch the ship sail away.
The artist saw something funny in the distance.  Draw what you think he saw.
_"Help me get these three tents set up!"_
Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!
Need a better playlab/events combo
This is a Play Lab level.  Move blocks to the workspace and see what happens!
Jorge the Dog wants to say "Hi there."  Can you help him?
Connect the `move left` block to the `when left` event block that is already in the workspace.
Add another event block to get Jorge to move right when the `right` button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the `up` and `down` buttons are pressed.
Make this more interesting by changing the background and playing a random sound when Jorge is clicked.
_Freeplay:_ Add anything you want to this game.
Give everyone something to do when you click on them.
Can you write code to show the rest of my friends? The hints will help you do this project step-by-step.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s: To get the bird to the pig, snap the <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block to the bottom of the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block, then press "▶ Run"!
Attach both <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> blocks to <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".
Grab a <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml> from the toolbox and add it to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".

There's an extra block at the end of this code!  

Drag it back to the toolbox to throw it away.
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Try this one all by yourself!
_"Play with these blocks and try to get me to the bad pig!"_
Give this one a try.

_"Here piggy, piggy!"_

What can you add to the end of this code to get the bird to the pig?
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!
**Challenge:** Avoid the TNT to get the bird to the pig!
Time for a shorter puzzle!  Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.
Get that pig!
Debug this level. Remove the extra blocks, and add the missing blocks. Get the bird to the pig!
Help the harvester pick the piece of corn!
Use <xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml> **three** times to get the harvester to the corn!
Use <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml> **three** times to get the harvester to the corn! Don't forget to pick the corn at the end.
Add _one_ block to help the harvester pick the corn.
Can you figure out what is wrong with this code? Help the harvester pick the corn!
Try it yourself!
You have to move in two directions to get to the corn! Help the harvester pick the right direction.
Now the harvester needs to pick corn two times!
Add two blocks to finish this puzzle!
The harvester needs to pick all the corn! Do you see a pattern?

_Thank you for helping me!_ 

Pick all the corn.
Try it by yourself! Pick all the corn.
Help the harvester pick corn!
Help the harvester pick all the corn!
The harvester needs to pick all the corn! Do you see a pattern?
Can you pick all the corn using only **one** move block?

_"I need help to find what's wrong!"_

Can you help the harvester find the bug in her code?
Try it yourself! Can you pick the corn at the end too?
Look at all this corn? Can you pick it all by yourself?
Can you change your code to make the harvester pick all the corn?

You will need **one** <xml><block type="maze_moveWest" block-text="move west"></block></xml> block and **one** <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth" block-text="move north"></block></xml> block to finish this puzzle!
Try it on your own!
Can you figure out how to pick _all_ this corn?
Help the harvester pick all five ears of corn!
Try one more on your own!

**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can.

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.
Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use this block: <xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml>
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block?

_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_  
(You do not have to get it all.)
_"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."_

Help the artist draw this line two times forward.

[][0]

Our artist is trying to draw a line five times, but can't get it right. Can you help?

[expandable][0]

Now, use a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="2-6">5</title></block></xml> loop to draw this line five times!

[expandable][0]

## Let's put a nice hill in the back.

[expandable][0]

## We need a ladder up to the boat.

[expandable][0]

## **Challenge:** The stairs down to the dock are broken.  Help me fix them.

[expandable][0]

## Help me build steps to watch the ship sail away.

[expandable][0]

The artist saw something funny in the distance.  Draw what you think he saw.

* * *

### Ideas

[][0]
[][1]
[][2]
[][3]

_"Help me get the camp site ready!"_

Use the blocks in the toolbox to draw these three tents.

You can use a loop to draw many lines in a row.

Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!  Try looking for patterns that repeat!

Here are some ideas:

[][0]

Help Jorge the Dog get moving by connecting the <xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> block to the <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml> event block that is already in the workspace.

Get Jorge to the flag to finish this level!
Now, add another event block to get Jorge to move right when the right arrow button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the up arrow and down arrow buttons are pressed.
_Freeplay:_ Add anything you want to this game.  Can you make the dinosaur disappear when Jorge runs into him?

Give everyone something to do when you click on them. What will the animals say? What else will happen?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints. The hints will give you fun things to try!

[][0]

Clicking Olive will make Robin appear! Can you write code to show the rest of the characters too?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints! The hints will help you do this project step-by-step!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming1_a: If the bird isn't getting to the pig, make sure both of the blocks have been fully clicked together, then click "Run" again.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming1_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try something, and if it doesn't work, try something else!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.1:
Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveSouth">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveWest">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveWest"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveWest">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveWest">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq1_a:
If you are having trouble getting the bird to move, make sure blocks are snapped in place under <xml>
  <block type="when_run"/>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq1_b:
The bird will need to move West 3 times to get to the pig. Use this block:

<xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.1: Try writing down the steps on paper to find a solution!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.2:
You will need to use this block:

<xml><block type="maze_moveSouth"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.1: Say the steps out loud and see if it helps you figure out the answer.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq6_a: Your final code should have 3 movement blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq6_b: If you get stuck, try solving the puzzle in 2 parts, one part before the corner and one part after the corner.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq8_a: If you're stuck, try drawing the image on paper to see how the bird should move.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq10_a: If you're having trouble, try writing down the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq10_b: You will need to go 3 different directions to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq13_a: If the path you need is unclear, use your finger to trace your way from the bird to the pig.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq13_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try adding blocks and running the code to see what will happen.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq13_c: These <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml><xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> blocks will help you move closer to the pig.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq_challenge1_a: There are two solutions to this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_maze_seq_challenge2_a: Try counting the spaces with your finger. Remember not to count the space where you start!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq1_a:
Use this block to pick the corn when the harvester finds it!

<xml>
  <block type="harvester_corn"/>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq1_b:
The harvester will need to move East three times to get to the corn. Use this block:

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"/>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq2_a: Don't forget to use <xml><block type="harvester_corn"/></xml> to pick the corn!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq2_b: Try writing down the steps on paper to find a solution!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq3_a:
Did you remember to use this block?

<xml><block type="harvester_corn"/></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq3_b: Say the steps out loud and see if it helps you figure out the answer.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq4_a: How many spaces are between the Harvester and the corn? How many blocks are already in your workspace?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq4_b:
You will need five `Move East` blocks and one `Pick Corn` block:

<xml><block type="harvester_corn"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq5_a: Which block moves the harvester the wrong way?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq5_b: You need to remove one block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq5_c:
Throw this block in the trash!

<xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq6_a: If you're stuck, try saying the steps out loud. It could help you figure out the right path.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq7_a: Try solving the puzzle in 2 parts, one part before the corner and one part after the corner.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq7_b: Having trouble? This is the path the harvester should take.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq8_a: Your final code should have **4** movement blocks and **2** pick blocks.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq9_a: Run the code a few times to see what happens. Where does the harvester stop?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq9_b: Don't forget to pick all the corn! You will need **3** pick corn blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq9_c: You should take this path to pick all the corn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq10_a: Are you stuck? Try writing down the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq10_b: You need to `Move East`, then `Move North`. Do this two times. Don't forget to get all the corn too!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_seq10_c: Try using this path to pick all the corn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_bee_seq1_a:
Use this block to pick corn once the harvester gets to it.

<xml>
  <block type="harvester_corn"/>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops1_a:
Once you move to some corn, use this block to pick it!

<xml><block type="harvester_corn"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops2_a:
Your code will have **four** `move west` <xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml> blocks

and **four** `pick corn` <xml><block type="harvester_corn"/></xml> blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops2_b: If you're still having trouble, try saying the steps out loud.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops3_a:
Use a `repeat` block like this to help you!

<xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
    <title name="TIMES" config="2-10">4</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops3_b:
To repeat code, drag out a `repeat` (<xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
    <title name="TIMES" config="2-10">4</title>
  </block></xml> )loop, then put the block you want inside of it.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops4_a: Don't be afraid to press `Run` to see what happens!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops4_b: How many pieces of corn are there? How many times does your code repeat?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5_a: If you get stuck, try solving the puzzle in 2 parts, one part before the corner and one part after the corner.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5_b:
Your final code will have **one** `repeat`  <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
    <title name="TIMES" config="2-10">6</title>
    </block></xml> loop, **one** `move South`   <xml><block type="maze_moveSouth" limit="1"/></xml> block, and **one** `move East`   <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" limit="1"/> </xml>block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5_c: Use this path to pick all the corn!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5a_a:
You will need one `repeat` <xml> <block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
    <title name="TIMES" config="2-10">6</title>
  </block></xml> loop after another.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5a_b: One loop will repeat `move South`<xml><block type="maze_moveSouth" limit="1"/></xml>, and the other will repeat `move East` <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" limit="1"/></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5a_c: Use this path to move one way, and then the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5b_b: Are your loops repeating the right number of times?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops5b_c: Move one way, then the other with this path.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops6_a: If you get stuck, try writing the steps on paper and looking for repeating patterns.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops6_b: This is the path you should take to pick all the corn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops7_a:
You will need two `repeat` <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
    <title name="TIMES" config="2-10">5</title>
  </block></xml>loops after each other!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops7_b: Use two loops to follow this path.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops9_a: Break this puzzle up into three different parts. One part to the first corner, one part to the second corner, and one part to the end.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops9_b: Don't be afraid to run your code after every part to see what happens!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_harvester_loops9_c: Follow this path to pick all the corn.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops1_a:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

<xml>  <block type="collector_collect"/></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops1_b: A simple solution would be to move East 2 times, then get the treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops2_a: You'll have to move before you can collect any treasure.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops2_b:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

<xml>  <block type="collector_collect"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops3_a: Try using a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops3_b: Remember, you can put more than 1 block inside a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops4_a: To change how far Laurel goes, change the number of times that the loop runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops4_b: Don't forget that Laurel needs to walk down and collect the treasure after she finishes the <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops5_a: If you can't figure out the answer right away, try using a piece of paper to figure out what arrows you will need and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops5_b: Try splitting the problem into 2 parts, moving sideways and then down.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops5_c: You'll want to start with a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop that moves Laurel west and collects treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out what's wrong? Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops6_b: The shortest solution has 2 <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops, one after the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops7_a: If you can't figure out what comes next, try running the code to see where Laurel ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops8_a: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops8_b: Try breaking this puzzle into 3 separate problems, and writing loops for each.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops8_c: Remember you can write one piece of the code at a time, then press "Run" to figure out where you need to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops9_a: If you can't spot the best places to use loops, try coding it out step-by-step and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops9_b: Try putting 2 of your <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops inside of another loop to make your code shorter!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_b: Try this path to get you to a solution.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_a: Can you use loops to solve this puzzle?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something seems wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave when you start, but you only need to get treasure 5 times moving South. Do you know why?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
The starting program doesn't collect the last 2 gems. Try adding this code at the very end:

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="collector_collect_simplified">
                            <next>
                              <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                <next>
                                  <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                </next>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_artist_loops2_a: Can't figure out how to draw a line?  Start attaching blocks to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_artist_loops2_b: Use this block <xml><block type="simple_move_right"/></xml> to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_a: Blocks like this <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_left"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_b: When you finish one tent, `jump` up twice to get to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_c: All of your blocks will need to be inside of a loop to finish this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events2_a: Look for a block that makes the dog say something.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events2_b:
This is the code you need to complete this puzzle:

<xml>
<block type="when_run" movable="false" deletable="false">
<next>
<block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Hi there.</title>
  </block>
</next>
</block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events3_a:
Drag this block  <xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> out and snap it to the bottom of <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events3_b: Remember to use the left arrow key to move Jorge to the flag once you have written your program. When the flag turns green, you've finished!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events4_a:
Here is the event block that you will need to get Jorge to move right:

<xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events4_b:
This is the code you will need to complete this puzzle:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">right</title>
    <next>
  <block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></next></block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events5_a:
Here are the event blocks that you will need to use to move Jorge up and down:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">up</title>
  </block></xml>

and 

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events5_b:
Did you know that you can change the key for  the event arrow by clicking on the picture in the block and choosing a new key?

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events6_a:
Here is the event block that you would use to have Jorge do something when clicked:

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events6_b:
Here is the block you would use to change the background:

<xml><block type="studio_setBackground">
    <title name="VALUE">random</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events6_c:
Here is the block you would use to play a random sound:

<xml><block type="studio_playSound">
    <title name="SOUND">random</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playLab_events7_a:
Use this block to control what happens when the actors collide.

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteCollided">
    <title name="SPRITE1">1</title>
    <title name="SPRITE2">0</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_a:
You can make a bird sing.

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Tweet</title>
          </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_b:
You can make a robot beep.

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      
          <block type="studio_playSound">
            <title name="SOUND">winpoint</title>
          </block>
        </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_c:
You can make an angry monster growl.

<xml>  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
        <title name="VALUE">2</title>
        <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Roar!</title>
            <next>
              <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
                <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
                <title name="VALUE">0</title>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make Waddles the Penguin show when you click Robin!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Make Boo the Ghost show when you click Waddles!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
Make Jayden the Fuzzy Monster show when you click Boo!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_d:
Make Spiff the Robot show when you click the monster!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2018/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_e:
Finally, make Wendel the Wizard show when you click Spiff!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">7</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
